Grading Policy
• Class participation 7%
• Beer Game Participation 4%
• Global Supply Chain Simulation Game Participation 4%
• Individual case report 10% (choose 1 out of 4 cases)
• Final group project 25%
• Final exam 50%
Class participation is based on the quality of comments, questions, discussions, voluntary presentations, and
simulation game performance each student offers during a class. Beer game participation and global supply
chain simulation game participation are based on whether each team/individual completes the corresponding
game.
Each individual student must submit at least one written case report out of the four cases to be discussed during
this course (if submit more than one, then the one with highest scores will enter the final grade). The case reports
should be concise (3-5 pages, 1-inch margins, 12-point font, double spaced, exhibits excluded) and focus on the
preparation questions, which will be posted on Blackboard. State clearly your assumptions, analysis and
recommendations.
A group final project, together with a final group presentation, is due on the last class (tentative deadlines:
presentation due on 30/11/2024, final report due 6/12/2024). The project should study an industry or a company,
which has recently (say in the past decade) experienced significant changes in supply chain management. You
should select a few questions from the following list and explore them in depth:
• What is the industry/company doing to create additional customer value and to increase revenue? OR,
What should they be doing? Justify any proposals.
• What is the industry/company doing to reduce supply chain costs (lost sales, inventory, warehousing,
transportation, etc.)? OR, What should they be doing? Justify any proposals.
• How has structure/coordination between the levels of the supply chain been changed? OR, how should it
change? Justify any proposals.
• What are the primary risks associated with the supply chain? How to mitigate? Justify any proposals.
• Which firms in the supply chain earn the most profits, and why? Justify any proposals.
3
• Discuss other important/innovative supply chain management activities if possible, such as sustainability,
share economy, social network, socially responsibility, etc.
You are not limited to the above set of general questions. You will also have the freedom to discuss any supply
chain related issues as well as the practices observed by the chosen company/industry.
